mark whether the registrant: (1) has filed all reports required to be filed by Section
13 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 during the preceding 12
months (or for such shorter period that the registrant was required to file
such reports), and (2) has been subject to such filing requirements for the

registrant is&#160; a large accelerated filer,
an accelerated filer, or a non-accelerated filer. See definition of &#147;accelerated
filer and large accelerated filer&#148; in Rule 12b-2 of the Exchange Act.
(Check one):</font></p>

there were 480,956,670 shares of the registrant&#146;s Class A Common Stock
outstanding, and 1,180,000,000 shares of the registrant&#146;s Class B Common Stock
outstanding.</font></p>

  Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</a></font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.4%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">57,814</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 3.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt -5.4pt .0001pt 4.5pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. and
Subsidiaries</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 3.6pt .0001pt 4.5pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Condensed Consolidated
Statements of Shareholders&#146; Equity<a name="CondensedConsolidatedStatementsOf_055948"></a></font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 3.6pt .0001pt 4.5pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2005 and</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 3.6pt .0001pt 4.5pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the Three Months Ended March&nbsp;31, 2006</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 3.6pt .0001pt 4.5pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(in millions of dollars,
except per share data)</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 3.6pt .0001pt 4.5pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(Unaudited)</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">$&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">$&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;23,493</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">$&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10,277</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">$&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1,195</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">)</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">$&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;29,977</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 3.6pt 12.0pt 4.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 3.6pt 12.0pt 4.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total
comprehensive earnings were $695 million for the quarter ended March&nbsp;31,
2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">See notes to condensed consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="75%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:75.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash and cash
  equivalents:</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.26%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.26%;">

 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">8</font></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\fc\12561913999_D11265_1080509\9721-1-do.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May  5 06:19 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">Kraft Foods Inc. and Subsidiaries<br>
Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements<a name="NotesToCondensedConsolidatedFinan_060339"></a><br>
(Unaudited)</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 3.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 1.&nbsp;Accounting Policies:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Basis of
Presentation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The interim
condensed consolidated financial statements of Kraft Foods Inc. (&#147;Kraft&#148;),
together with its subsidiaries (collectively referred to as the &#147;Company&#148;), are
unaudited. It is the opinion of the Company&#146;s management that all adjustments
necessary for a fair statement of the interim results presented have been
reflected therein. All such adjustments were of a normal recurring nature. Net
revenues and net earnings for any interim period are not necessarily indicative
of results that may be expected for the entire year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">These statements should be read in conjunction with
the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements and related notes, which are
included in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December
31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2005, the
Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery business for pre-tax
proceeds of approximately $1.4 billion. The Company has reflected the results
of its sugar confectionery business prior to the closing date as discontinued
operations on the condensed consolidated statements of earnings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October 2005,
the Company announced that, effective January 1, 2006, its Canadian business
will be realigned to better integrate it into the Company&#146;s North American
business by product category. Beginning in the first quarter of 2006, the
operating results of the Canadian business are being reported throughout the
North American food segments. In addition, in the first quarter of 2006, the
Company&#146;s international businesses were realigned to reflect the reorganization
announced within Europe in November 2005. The two revised international
segments, which are reflected in these condensed consolidated financial
statements and notes, are European Union; and Developing Markets, Oceania &amp;
North Asia, the latter to reflect the Company&#146;s increased management focus on
developing markets. Accordingly, prior period segment results have been
restated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Stock-Based Compensation Expense</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective January 1, 2006,
the Company adopted the provisions of Statement of Financial Accounting
Standards (&#147;SFAS&#148;) No. 123 (Revised 2004) &#147;Share-Based Payment&#148; (&#147;SFAS No. 123(R)&#148;)
using the modified prospective method, which requires measurement of
compensation cost for all stock-based awards at fair value on date of grant and
recognition of compensation over the service periods for awards expected to
vest. The fair value of restricted stock and rights to receive shares of stock
is determined based on the number of shares granted and the market value at
date of grant. The fair value of stock options is determined using a modified
Black-Scholes methodology. The impact of the adoption was not material.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company previously
applied the recognition and measurement principles of Accounting Principles
Board Opinion No. 25, &#147;Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees,&#148; (&#147;APB 25&#148;)
and provided the pro forma disclosures required by SFAS No. 123, &#147;Accounting
for Stock-Based Compensation&#148; (&#147;SFAS No. 123&#148;). No compensation expense for
employee stock options was previously reflected in net earnings, as all stock
options granted under those plans had an exercise price equal to the market
value of the common stock on the date of the grant. Historical condensed
consolidated statements of earnings already include the compensation expense
for restricted stock and rights to receive shares of stock. The following table
illustrates the effect on net earnings and earnings per share (&#147;EPS&#148;) if the
Company had applied the fair value recognition provisions of SFAS No. 123 to
measure stock-based compensation expense for outstanding stock-based option
awards for the quarter ended March 31, 2005 (in millions, except per share data):</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">9</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\fc\128112756688_D10466_1087023\9721-1-dq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May  8 11:28 2006' -->

 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc.
and Subsidiaries<br>
Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements<br>
(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="88%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:88.9%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.56%;">

</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The adoption of SFAS No. 123(R)
resulted in a cumulative effect gain of $6 million, which is net of $3 million
in taxes, in the condensed consolidated statement of earnings for the quarter
ended March 31, 2006. This gain results from the impact of estimating future
forfeitures on restricted stock and rights to receive shares of stock in the
determination of periodic expense for unvested awards, rather than recording
forfeitures only when they occur. The gross cumulative effect was recorded in
marketing, administration and research costs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under SFAS No. 123(R), tax
shortfalls occur when actual tax deductible compensation expense is less than
cumulative stock-based compensation expense recognized in the financial
statements. Tax shortfalls of $10 million were recognized for the three months
ended March 31, 2006, and were recorded in additional paid-in capital.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 2.&nbsp;Asset
Impairment, Exit and Implementation Costs:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:12.0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">R</font></i><i><font style="font-style:italic;">estructuring Program:</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In January 2004, the Company announced a three-year
restructuring program with the objectives of leveraging the Company&#146;s global
scale, realigning and lowering its cost structure, and optimizing capacity
utilization. I</font>n January 2006,
the Company announced plans to expand its restructuring efforts through 2008. The
entire restructuring program is expected to result in $3.7 billion in pre-tax
charges reflecting asset disposals, severance and implementation costs. As part
of this program, the Company anticipates the closure of up to 40 facilities and
the elimination of approximately 14,000 positions. Approximately $2.3 billion
of the $3.7 billion in pre-tax charges are expected to require cash payments. P<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">re-tax restructuring program charges during 2006
are expected to be approximately $1.3 billion, including $105 million incurred
in the first quarter of 2006. Total pre-tax restructuring charges incurred
since the inception of the program in January 2004 were $1.043 billion.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring
Costs:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the first
quarter of 2006 and 2005, pre-tax charges under the restructuring program of
$92 million and $57 million, respectively, were recorded as asset impairment
and exit costs on the condensed consolidated statements of earnings. The first
quarter 2006 pre-tax charges resulted from the announcement of the closing of 4
plants, for a total of 23 since January 2004, and the continuation of a number
of workforce reduction programs. Approximately $56 million of the first quarter
2006 pre-tax charges will require cash payments.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">10</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Severance costs in
the above schedule, which relate to the workforce reduction programs, include
the cost of related benefits. Specific programs announced since 2004, as part
of the overall restructuring program, will result in the elimination of
approximately 6,800 positions. At March 31, 2006, approximately 5,400 of these
positions have been eliminated. Asset write-downs relate to the impairment of
assets caused by the plant closings and related activity. Other costs incurred
relate primarily to contract termination costs associated with the plant
closings and the termination of leasing agreements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Implementation
Costs:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
recorded pre-tax implementation costs associated with the restructuring program.
These costs include the discontinuance of certain product lines and incremental
costs related to the integration and streamlining of functions and closure of
facilities. Substantially all implementation costs incurred in 2006 will
require cash payments. These costs were recorded on the condensed consolidated
statements of earnings as follows:</font></p>

<div align="center">

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="144" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:107.8pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(in millions)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="402" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:301.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cost of sales</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="57" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:42.9pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Asset
Impairment Charges:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During March 2006,
the Company reached an agreement to sell its pet snacks brand and assets for
$580 million. The transaction is subject to regulatory approval. The Company
incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $86 million in the first quarter
of 2006 in recognition of the pending sale. The charge, which includes the
write-off of a portion of the associated goodwill, and intangible and fixed
assets, was recorded as asset impairment and exit costs on the condensed
consolidated statement of earnings. Upon completion of the transaction, the
Company expects to record additional taxes of approximately $60 million related
to the sale.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During March 2005,
the Company reached an agreement to sell its fruit snacks assets for
approximately $30 million. The transaction closed in the second quarter of 2005.
The Company incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $93 million in the
first quarter of 2005 in recognition of the sale. The charge, which included
the write-off of all associated intangible assets, was recorded as asset
impairment and exit costs on the condensed consolidated statement of earnings.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">11</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\fc\128112756688_D10466_1087023\9721-1-dq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May  8 11:28 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc.
and Subsidiaries<br>
Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements<br>
(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the first
quarter of 2006, the Company completed its annual review of goodwill and
intangible assets and recorded non-cash pre-tax charges of $24 million related
to an intangible asset impairment for biscuits assets in Egypt and hot cereal
assets in the United States. These charges were recorded as asset impairment
and exit costs on the condensed consolidated statement of earnings. During the
first quarter of 2005, the Company completed its annual review of goodwill and
intangible assets and no charges resulted from this review.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Total:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The pre-tax asset
impairment, exit and implementation costs discussed above, for the three months
ended March 31, 2006 and March 31, 2005, were included in the operating
companies income of the following segments:</font></p>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.98%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">169</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">12</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\fc\128112756688_D10466_1087023\9721-1-dq.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May  8 11:28 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc.
and Subsidiaries<br>
Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements<br>
(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 3.&nbsp;Related
Party Transactions:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At March 31, 2006, Altria Group, Inc. owned 87.6% of
the Company&#146;s outstanding shares of capital stock. Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s
subsidiary, Altria Corporate Services, Inc., provides the Company with various
services, including planning, legal, treasury, auditing, insurance, human
resources, office of the secretary, corporate affairs, information technology,
aviation and tax services. Billings for these services, which were based on the
cost to Altria Corporate Services, Inc. to provide such services and a 5%
management fee based on wages and benefits, were $52 million and $63 million
for the three months ended March 31, 2006 and 2005, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At March 31, 2006, the Company had short-term amounts
payable to Altria Group, Inc. of $472 million. The amounts payable to Altria
Group, Inc. generally include accrued dividends, taxes and service fees. Interest
on intercompany borrowings is based on the applicable London Interbank Offered
Rate.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Also, see Note 12. <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Income Taxes</font></i>
regarding the impact to the Company of the recent closure of an Internal
Revenue Service review of Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated federal income tax
return. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 4.&nbsp;Divestitures:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Discontinued
Operations:</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2005, the
Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery business for pre-tax
proceeds of approximately $1.4 billion. The sale included the <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Life Savers</font></i>, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Creme Savers</font></i>, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Altoids</font></i>, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Trolli</font></i> and <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Sugus</font></i> brands. The Company has reflected the results of its
sugar confectionery business prior to the closing date as discontinued
operations on the condensed consolidated statements of earnings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Summary results of
operations for the sugar confectionery business for the three months ended March
31, 2005 were as follows (in millions):</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other:</font></i></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the first quarter of 2006, the Company sold certain Canadian
assets and a small U.S. biscuit brand. In recognition of these sales, the
Company incurred pre-tax asset impairment charges of $176 million in the fourth
quarter of 2005. During the first quarter of 2005, the Company sold its U.K.
desserts assets, its U.S. yogurt assets and a minor trademark in Mexico. The
aggregate proceeds received from these sales during the first quarter of 2006
and 2005 were $88 million and $190 million, respectively. The Company recorded
pre-tax losses from sales of businesses of $3</font>  </font>million during the first quarter of 2006, and
recorded pre-tax gains from sales of businesses of $116 million during the
first quarter of 2005.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During March 2006,
the Company reached an agreement to sell its pet snacks brand and assets for
$580 million. The transaction is subject to regulatory approval. The Company
incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $86 million in the first quarter
of 2006 in recognition of the pending sale. Upon completion of the transaction,
the Company expects to record additional taxes of approximately $60 million
related to the sale.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">13</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\fc\12811308201_D10466_1087023\9721-1-ds.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May  8 11:30 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc.
and Subsidiaries<br>
Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements<br>
(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During March 2005,
the Company reached an agreement to sell its fruit snacks assets for
approximately $30 million. The transaction closed in the second quarter of 2005.
The Company incurred a pre-tax asset impairment charge of $93 million in the
first quarter of 2005 in recognition of the sale.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In April 2006, the
Company announced an agreement to sell its industrial coconut assets. The
transaction is expected to close in the second quarter of 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The operating
results of the other divestitures, discussed above, in the aggregate, were not
material to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of
operations or cash flows in any of the periods presented.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 5.&nbsp;Stock
Plans:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the Kraft 2005 Performance Incentive Plan (the &#147;2005 Plan&#148;), the
Company may grant to eligible employees awards of stock options, stock
appreciation rights, restricted stock, restricted and deferred stock units, and
other awards based on the Company&#146;s Class A common stock, as well as
performance-based annual and long-term incentive awards. A maximum of 150
million shares of the Company&#146;s Class A common stock may be issued under the
2005 Plan, of which no more than 45 million shares may be awarded as restricted
stock. In addition, the Company may grant up to 500,000 shares of Class A
common stock to members of the Board of Directors who are not full-time
employees of the Company or Altria Group, Inc., or their subsidiaries, under
the Kraft Directors Plan (the &#147;2001 Directors Plan&#148;). Shares available to be
granted under the 2005 Plan and the 2001 Directors Plan at March 31, 2006, were
143,618,430 and 439,367, respectively. Restricted shares available for grant
under the 2005 Plan at March 31, 2006, were 38,618,430.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In February 2006, the
Company&#146;s Board of Directors adopted, and in April 2006, the stockholders
approved, the Kraft 2006 Stock Compensation Plan for Non-Employee Directors
(the &#147;2006 Directors Plan&#148;). The 2006 Directors Plan replaced the 2001
Directors Plan. Under the 2006 Directors Plan, the Company may grant up to
500,000 shares of Class A common stock to members of the Board of Directors who
are not full-time employees of the Company or Altria Group, Inc., or their
subsidiaries, over a five-year period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Generally, stock options are granted at an exercise price equal to the
fair value of the underlying stock on the date of the grant, become exercisable
on the first anniversary of the grant date and have a maximum term of ten years.
However, the Company has not granted stock options to its employees since 2002.
Restricted stock generally vests on the third anniversary of the grant date.</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock Option Plan</font></u></h1>

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No options were exercised during the three months ended March 31, 2006.
The total intrinsic value of options exercised during the three months ended March
31, 2005 was $0.4 million.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">14</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='14',FILE='C:\fc\12811308201_D10466_1087023\9721-1-ds.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May  8 11:30 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc.
and Subsidiaries<br>
Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements<br>
(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior to the initial public offering (&#147;IPO&#148;), certain employees of the
Company participated in Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s stock compensation plans. Altria
Group, Inc. does not intend to issue additional Altria Group, Inc. stock
compensation to the Company&#146;s employees, except for reloads of previously
issued options.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pre-tax compensation cost
and the related tax benefit for stock option awards totaled $1.4 million and
$0.5 million, respectively, for the three months ended March 31, 2006. The fair
value of the awards was determined using a modified Black-Scholes methodology
using the following assumptions for Altria Group, Inc. common stock:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14.15</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="183" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="60" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>

 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

options to purchase the following number of shares of Altria Group, Inc. stock
at March 31, 2006:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Restricted Stock Plans</font></u></h1>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company may grant shares of restricted stock and rights to receive
shares of stock to eligible employees, giving them in most instances all of the
rights of stockholders, except that they may not sell, assign, pledge or
otherwise encumber such shares and rights. Such shares and rights are subject
to forfeiture if certain employment conditions are not met.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of the restricted shares and rights at the date of grant
is amortized to expense ratably over the restriction period. The Company
recorded pre-tax compensation expense related to restricted stock and rights of
$23 million, including the pre-tax cumulative effect gain of $9 million from
the adoption of SFAS No. 123(R), and $38 million for the three months ended March
31, 2006 and 2005, respectively. The tax benefit recorded related to this
compensation expense was $8 million and $14 million for the three months ended March
31, 2006 and 2005, respectively. The unamortized compensation expense related
to the Company&#146;s restricted stock and rights was $329 million at March 31, 2006
and is expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of 2 years.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">15</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The weighted-average grant date fair value of restricted stock
and rights granted during the three months ended March 31, 2006 and 2005 was
$185 million and $196 million, respectively, or $29.00 and $33.32 per
restricted share or right, respectively. The total fair value of restricted
stock and rights vested during the three months ended March 31, 2006 was $115
million. No restricted stock and rights vested during the three months ended March
31, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 6.&nbsp;Earnings
Per Share:</font></u></b></p>

EPS from continuing and discontinued operations were calculated using the
following:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the quarter ended March 31, 2006, all of the Class
A common stock options were excluded from the calculation of weighted average
shares for diluted EPS because their effects were antidilutive (i.e. the cash
that would be received upon exercise is greater than the average market price
of the stock during the period). For the quarter ended March 31, 2005, the
number of stock options excluded from the calculation of weighted average
shares for diluted EPS because their effects were antidilutive was immaterial.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 7.&nbsp;Contingencies:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft and its subsidiaries are parties to a variety of
legal proceedings arising out of the normal course of business, including a few
cases in which substantial amounts of damages are sought. While the results of
litigation cannot be predicted with certainty, management believes that the
final outcome of these proceedings will not have a material adverse effect on
the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash
flows.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">16</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc.
and Subsidiaries<br>
Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements<br>
(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Third-Party Guarantees:</font></i>
At March 31, 2006, the Company&#146;s third-party guarantees, which are primarily
derived from acquisition and divestiture activities, approximated $25 million. Substantially
all of these guarantees expire through 2013, with $12 million expiring through March
31, 2007. The Company is required to perform under these guarantees in the
event that a third party fails to make contractual payments or achieve
performance measures. The Company has a liability of $16 million on its
condensed consolidated balance sheet at March 31, 2006, relating to these
guarantees.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 8. Goodwill
and Other Intangible Assets, Net:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Goodwill by reportable
segment was as follows:</font></p>

follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Non-amortizable
intangible assets consist substantially of brand names purchased through the
Nabisco acquisition. Amortizable intangible assets consist primarily of certain
trademark licenses and non-compete agreements. Amortization expense for
intangible assets was $2 million and $3 million for the quarters ended March 31,
2006 and 2005, respectively. Amortization expense for each of the next five
years is currently estimated to be approximately $7 million or less.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">17</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='17',FILE='C:\fc\128113144830_D10466_1087023\9721-1-du.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May  8 11:32 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
 <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"></p>


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc.
and Subsidiaries<br>
Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements<br>
(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The movement in
goodwill and gross carrying amount of intangible assets from December 31, 2005,
is as follows:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="80%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:80.18%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.12%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Goodwill</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.12%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Intangible<br>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt .0001pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 9. Segment
Reporting:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company manufactures
and markets packaged food products, consisting principally of beverages,
cheese, snacks, convenient meals and various packaged grocery products. Kraft
manages and reports operating results through two units, Kraft North America
Commercial and Kraft International Commercial. Reportable segments for Kraft
North America Commercial are organized and managed principally by product
category. Kraft International Commercial&#146;s operations are organized and managed
by geographic location.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October 2005,
the Company announced that, effective January 1, 2006, its Canadian business
will be realigned to better integrate it into the Company&#146;s North American
business by product category. Beginning in the first quarter of 2006, the
operating results of the Canadian business are being reported throughout the
North American food segments. In addition, in the first quarter of 2006, the
Company&#146;s international businesses were realigned to reflect the reorganization
announced within Europe in November 2005. The two revised international
segments are European Union; and Developing Markets, Oceania &amp; North Asia,
the latter to reflect the Company&#146;s increased management focus on developing
markets. Accordingly, prior period segment results have been restated.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s ma</font><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;">nagement
uses operating companies income, which is defined as operating income before
general corporate expenses and amortization of intangibles, to evaluate segment
performance and allocate resources. Management believes it is appropriate to
disclose this measure to help investors analyze the business performance and
trends of the various business segments. Interest and other debt expense, net,
and provision for income taxes are centrally managed and, accordingly, such
items are not presented by segment since they are not included in the measure
of segment profitability reviewed by management.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Segment data were
as follows:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

and Subsidiaries<br>

(Unaudited)</font></p>

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Earnings from
  continuing operations before income taxes and minority interest:</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="75%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:75.78%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating companies
  income:</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.32%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">981 </font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt .0001pt 0pt;text-indent:40.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As discussed in Note 2. <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Asset
Impairment, Exit and Implementation Costs</font></i>, the Company recorded
asset impairment, exit and implementation costs of $215 million and $169
million during the first quarter of 2006 and 2005, respectively. See Note 2 for
a breakdown of these pre-tax charges by segment.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the first quarter of 2006, the Company sold certain Canadian
assets and</font> recorded a pre-tax loss of $1 million. This loss is included
in the operating companies income of the North America Grocery segment. </font>In addition, the Company sold a small U.S.
biscuit brand, resulting in a pre-tax loss of $2 million. This loss is
included in the operating companies income of the North America Snacks &amp;
Cereals segment.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the first
quarter of 2005, the Company sold its U.K. desserts assets and recorded a
pre-tax gain of $115 million. This gain is included in the operating companies
income of the European Union segment. In addition, the Company sold a minor
trademark in Mexico, resulting in a pre-tax gain of $1 million. This gain is
included in the operating companies income of the Developing Markets, Oceania &amp;
North Asia segment.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">19</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='19',FILE='C:\fc\128113144830_D10466_1087023\9721-1-du.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May  8 11:32 2006' -->

and Subsidiaries<br>
Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements<br>
(Unaudited)</font></p>

consumer sector, which include the separation of Foodservice into sector
components, were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 20.35pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note 10.
Financial Instruments:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the quarters ended March 31, 2006 and
2005, ineffectiveness related to cash flow hedges was not material. At March 31,
2006, the Company was hedging forecasted transactions for periods not exceeding
the next twenty-one months and expects substantially all amounts reported in
accumulated other comprehensive </font><font face="Times New Roman">earnings
(losses) to be reclassified to the consolidated statement of earnings within
the next twelve months.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">20</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

taxes, as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
11. Benefit Plans:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company sponsors noncontributory defined benefit pension plans
covering substantially all U.S. employees. Pension coverage for employees of the
Company&#146;s non-U.S. subsidiaries is provided, to the extent deemed appropriate,
through separate plans, many of which are governed by local statutory
requirements. In addition, the Company&#146;s U.S. and Canadian subsidiaries provide
health care and other benefits to substantially all retired employees. Health
care benefits for retirees outside the United States and Canada are generally
covered through local government plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Pension Plans</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Components of Net Periodic Benefit Cost</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net periodic
pension cost consisted of the following for the three months ended March 31,
2006 and 2005:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="53%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:53.08%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="20%" colspan="5" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:20.68%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">U.S. Plans</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

<p style="margin:0pt 20.7pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other expense, above, is due primarily to additional pension benefits
related to workforce reduction programs under the Company&#146;s restructuring
program and is included as part of asset impairment and exit costs.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">21</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc.
and Subsidiaries<br>
Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements<br>
(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Employer
Contributions</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company
presently makes, and plans to make, contributions, to the extent that they are
tax deductible and do not generate an excise tax liability, in order to
maintain plan assets in excess of the accumulated benefit obligation of its
funded U.S. and non-U.S. plans. During the first quarter of 2006, approximately
$130 million and approximately $25 million of employer contributions were made
to U.S. plans and non-U.S. plans, respectively. Currently, the Company
anticipates making additional contributions of approximately $20 million during
the remainder of 2006 to its U.S. plans and approximately $80 million during
the remainder of 2006 to its non-U.S. plans, based on current tax law. However,
these estimates are subject to change as a result of many factors, including
changes in tax and other benefit laws, as well as asset performance
significantly above or below the assumed long-term rate of return on pension
assets, or significant changes in interest rates. During the first quarter of
2005, approximately $200 million and approximately $40 million of employer
contributions were made to U.S. plans and non-U.S. plans, respectively.</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Postretirement Benefit Plans</font></i></h1>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net postretirement
health care costs consisted of the following for the three months ended March 31,
2006 and 2005:</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
12. Income Taxes:</font></u></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company accounts for income taxes in accordance
with SFAS No. 109, &#147;Accounting for Income Taxes.&#148; The U.S. accounts of the
Company are included in the consolidated federal income tax return of Altria
Group, Inc. Income taxes are generally computed on a separate company basis. To
the extent that foreign tax credits, capital losses and other credits generated
by the Company, which cannot currently be utilized on a separate company basis,
are utilized in Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated federal income tax return,
the benefit is recognized in the calculation of the Company&#146;s provision for
income taxes. The Company makes payments to, or is reimbursed by, Altria Group,
Inc. for the tax effects resulting from its inclusion in Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s
consolidated federal income tax return, including current taxes payable and net
changes in tax provisions. Significant judgment is required in determining
income tax provisions and in evaluating tax positions. The Company establishes
additional provisions for income taxes when, despite the belief that existing
tax positions are fully supportable, there remain certain positions that are
likely to be challenged and that may not be sustained on review by tax
authorities. The Company evaluates and potentially adjusts these provisions in
light of changing facts and circumstances. The consolidated tax provision
includes the impact of changes to accruals that are considered appropriate. Upon
the closure of current and future tax audits in various jurisdictions,
significant income tax accrual reversals could continue to occur, which could
trigger cash reimbursements from Altria Group, Inc.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">22</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\fc\12811322736_D10466_1087023\9721-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May  8 11:32 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc.
and Subsidiaries<br>
Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements<br>
(Unaudited)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is regularly
audited by federal, state and foreign tax authorities, and these audits are at
various stages at any given time. Any tax contingency reserves in excess of
additional assessed liabilities will be reversed at the time the audits close.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the first quarter of
2006, the United States Internal Revenue Service concluded its examination of
Altria Group, Inc.&#146;s consolidated tax returns for the years 1996 through 1999
and issued a final Revenue Agents Report on March 15, 2006. Consequently,
Altria Group, Inc. reimbursed the Company in cash for unrequired federal tax
reserves of $337 million and pre-tax interest of $46 million ($29 million
after-tax). The Company also recognized net state tax reversals of $39 million,
resulting in a total net earnings benefit of $405 million or $0.24 per diluted
share, in the first quarter of 2006.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">23</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='23',FILE='C:\fc\12811322736_D10466_1087023\9721-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May  8 11:32 2006' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="8%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.92%;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 2.</font><a name="Item2__060759"></a></p>
  </td>
  <td width="80%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:80.24%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">MANAGEMENT&#146;S
  DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF<br>
  FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:10.84%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 21.6pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Description
of the Company</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Kraft Foods Inc. (&#147;Kraft&#148;),
together with its subsidiaries (collectively referred to as the &#147;Company&#148;),
manufactures and markets packaged food products, consisting principally of
beverages, cheese, snacks, convenient meals and various packaged grocery
products. Kraft manages and reports operating results through two units, Kraft
North America Commercial and Kraft International Commercial. Reportable
segments for Kraft North America Commercial are organized and managed
principally by product category. Kraft International Commercial&#146;s operations
are organized and managed by geographic location. At March 31, 2006, Altria
Group, Inc. held 98.3% of the combined voting power of Kraft&#146;s outstanding
capital stock and owned 87.6% of the outstanding shares of Kraft&#146;s capital
stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.5pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October 2005,
the Company announced that, effective January 1, 2006, its Canadian business
will be realigned to better integrate it into the Company&#146;s North American
business by product category. Beginning in the first quarter of 2006, the
operating results of the Canadian business are being reported throughout the
North American food segments. In addition, in the first quarter of 2006, the
Company&#146;s international businesses were realigned to reflect the reorganization
announced within Europe in November 2005. The two revised international
segments, which are reflected in this report, are European Union and Developing
Markets, Oceania &amp; North Asia, the latter to reflect the Company&#146;s
increased management focus on developing markets. Accordingly, prior period
segment results have been restated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June 2005, the
Company sold substantially all of its sugar confectionery business for pre-tax
proceeds of approximately $1.4 billion. The Company has reflected the results
of its sugar confectionery business prior to the closing date as discontinued
operations on the condensed consolidated statements of earnings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.85pt 12.0pt 0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In April 2006, the
Company announced a seven-year, $1.7 billion agreement to receive information
technology services from Electronic Data Systems (EDS). The agreement, which
includes data centers, web hosting, telecommunications and IT workplace
services, begins on June 1, 2006. Pursuant to the agreement, approximately 670
employees, who provide certain IT support to the Company, are expected to
transition to EDS. As a result, the Company will recognize asset impairment and
implementation costs, which will be expensed as part of the Company&#146;s
previously announced restructuring program.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 24.3pt 12.0pt 0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As previously
communicated, for significant business reasons, the Altria Group, Inc. Board of
Directors is looking at a number of restructuring alternatives, including the
possibility of separating Kraft from the balance of Altria Group, Inc. Altria
Group, Inc. has indicated that continuing improvements in its litigation
environment are a prerequisite to such action by its Board of Directors, and
the timing and chronology of events are uncertain.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">24</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='24',FILE='C:\fc\12811322736_D10466_1087023\9721-1-dw.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May  8 11:32 2006' -->

executive summary is intended to provide significant highlights of the
Discussion and Analysis that follows.</font></p>

Operating Results for the Quarter ended March 31, 2006</font></i>  <font face="Symbol">-</font>

from continuing operations for the quarter ended March 31, 2006 from the
quarter ended March 31, 2005 were due primarily to the following (in millions,

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">52</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,006</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.82%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
